channel.title: Compiling on Linux kernel programming blog

item.title: Getting Started
item.description:
Check out code

I recommend checking out the Rust-for-Linux kernel to play around with, because it has many more sample modules than the mainline kernel. Even though the interfaces are probably not stable, you can get an idea where development is headed.

Get your tools ready

After checking out, you should follow the instructions in Documentation/rust/quick-start.rst for setting up your tools. I had more luck using rustup to get the versions of bindgen and rustc compatible with the kernel than using my distributions aptitude command. There is a nifty little script called rust_is_available.sh which will tell you whether your setup works for compiling a Rust kernel.
